etymologies: Middle English: reduced form of sire

definitions: used as a polite or respectful way of addressing a man, especially one in a position of authority
shortDefinitions: used as polite or respectful way of addressing man

definitions: used to address a man at the beginning of a formal or business letter
shortDefinitions: used to address man at beginning of formal or business letter

definitions: (in Britain) used as a title before the given name of a knight or baronet.
shortDefinitions: used as title before forename of knight or baronet
